By torey luvullo on Friday, October 24, 2003 - 05:58 am:

S Class 3,Bracket 2 MORNING LINE


This is as difficult a group of monsters that I have ever had to assess. Two Jills who are more alike than they first appear. One of those Jills with nearly identical stats and form to the PeachTree Bug. Then throw a speed durahan into the mix...

Here goes nothing:

MonsterBreedTrainerOdds
WelcomeDurahanRedHare5-2
PrincessPeachTreeBugHellraiser3-1
FMFBengalInfernus3-1
Petit-TrotPierryStrunks3-1


I am picking the durahan - as much to illustrate my confusion as anything. Welcome has the classic mix of a good durahan, and he does not face a pure int monster who can take advantage of his int weakness.

The other three could easily win - I am not familiar enough with the moveset of cp's and jills in tourneys to know which of the 3 will emerge. Princess has a unique cp moveset - i have never seen vital ritual, so it could be great; it could be a guts drain. FMF has slap combo, whereas Petit-Trot does not - advantage, or potential guts drain? The two Jills are stat-wise more equal than they appear, thanks to the Pierry's skinniness. FMF's giving up of a level could make the difference in a close match. The sole reason to list Petit-Trot last is tradition.

I wish I could be there for this event - maybe things will break where I can.
